commitResults.messageTitle: changed file name, changed greeting
added echo feature, changed goodbye text
added store to list, displays stored items when list is input
added task function, ability to mark as completed or incomplete. created new task class
created 3 new classes todo, event, deadline, edited popup message
added automated text ui testcase, ran checks
added try catch blocks to catch some exceptions and wrongful input
added a delete task function
refactore code to categorise code into methods, write to list of tasks file whenever changes are made
ran some direct tests
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
group methods and fields into separate classes previously all under Meerkat.java, not grouped into relevant classes missed the date and time assignment, will do it after this
group methods and fields into separate classes previously all under Meerkat.java, not grouped into relevant classes missed the date and time assignment, will do it after this
Merge tag 'A-MoreOOP'
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/meerkatboy/ip
Merge branch 'add-gradle-support'
add gradle files
Merge remote-tracking branch 'remotes/origin/add-gradle-support' into HEAD
Add Gradle Support
commitResults.messageBody:
The previous version of the chatbot did not support building and running using Gradle

Merged the add-gradle-support remote branch and added the relevant files to support Gradle build

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit support and DateTime functionality.
commitResults.messageBody:
Programme before commit did not support running JUnit tests and previous DateTime implementation was deleted on accident.

Current program parses string input into LocalDateTime and supports JUnit tests

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-JUnit'
Package chatbot as a jar and fixed a bug.
commitResults.messageBody:
Before commit, chatbot did not exist as a jar and bug caused all tasks to be marked as undone.

Tasks are now correctly marked based on save file after editing switch statements, chatbot exists as jar.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc functionality.
commitResults.messageBody:
Code beforehand could have been confusing without JavaDoc annotation.

Now with annotation, other readers will be able to determine code functionality clearly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify code to adhere to coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Some constants were not in screaming snake case and some unnecessary
variables were declared.

Removed unnecessary variables and modified constants to screaming snake
case.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify UI class to restrict code line length
commitResults.messageBody:
A line of code was 160 characters long.

Modified to shorten it to adhere to coding standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Lack function to find tasks based on keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Longer search time to identify tasks

Providing find functionality increases efficiency

Let's add a function where users can input keyword and a list of
tasks matching the keyword will be displayed

commitResults.messageTitle: Add CheckStyle function
commitResults.messageBody:
Has no CheckStyle functionality so we may stray away from coding
standards

Adhering to coding standards is essential for ensuring code readability

Running checkstyle tests with Gradle ensures checks in code style is
consistently run

commitResults.messageTitle: Add GUI to chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot had been solely text based

Text based chatbot can be less engaging and fun for users

Use of JavaFx to create GUI enhances user experience

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify GUI to make it more aesthetic
commitResults.messageBody:
Was very plan and unengaging

Improved design will better attract target audience usage

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to improve code CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody:
Method lengths are too long in some cases

Shorten the code through extraction of code blocks into separate methods

Makes code easier to read and debug

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to reduce method length
commitResults.messageBody:
Duplicates in tasklist can confuse the user.

By implementing function to detect duplicates, user can no longer add
a task if an identical task is already present in the taskList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Finalise function to detect duplicates
commitResults.messageBody:
Duplicates can be very confusing for the user when they look back at
the task list, especially when they intend to make any edits.

Finalising the function to detect duplicates to prevent them from being
added in the first place can help to avoid that problem.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add information into README regarding features
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot features can be difficult to navigate for first time users.
Having a README can help one explore the features of the chatbot, to
utilise it more effectively.

Detailed descriptions of the features, as well as example usages
are reflected to make the chatbot more easy to understand and use.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add to feature list in README
commitResults.messageBody:
Include other features that were previously not included. This makes
the README more comprehensive.
